properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Buses will be in high demand so allow extra travel time. Avoid the largest crowds by visiting on a weekday instead. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sculpture by the Sea exhibition returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk for 18 days from Friday 18 October to Monday 4 November. Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions will be in place.

With up to 500,000 people expected to visit throughout the exhibition, significant delays are expected on roads approaching Bondi and Tamarama beaches including Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. 

Motorists should avoid driving through the area where possible or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time, particularly on weekends.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions:

  • Local roads will close from 7:30am to 6:30pm daily in Bronte, Bondi and Tamarama including sections of Ashley St, Bayview St, Birell St, Carlisle St, Darling St, Fletcher St. Illawong Ave, Kenneth St, Marks Ln, Notts Ave, Rowland Ave, Silvia St, Turner St, Wilga St and Wolaroi Cres.
  • One-way traffic conditions will be in place around the coastal walk for the duration of the event from 9am Friday 18 October until 10am Monday 4 November. Allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers and exercise caution.

Special event clearways: Strict parking restrictions will be in effect each weekend of the event on Saturday 19 and Sunday 20 October, Saturday 26 and Sunday 27 October and Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 November at the following times and locations:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd between Old South Head and opposite Sandridge St at Bondi Beach (northern side)
  • 12pm midday to 7pm: Bondi Rd between Sandridge St at Bondi Beach and Oxford St at Bondi Junction (southern side)
  • 8am to 4pm: Campbell Pde between Queen Elizabeth Drive and Beach Rd at Bondi Beach (Eastern side)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

BRONTE, TAMARAMA & BONDI

7:30AM TO 6:30PM DAILY FROM FRIDAY 18 OCTOBER TO MONDAY 4 NOVEMBER 2024

Access will be maintained for residents and taxis only

  • Ashley St between Turner St and end of lane
  • Bayview St between West of Bronte Marine Drive and end of street
  • Birrell St between Tamarama St and Cross St (Eastbound lanes only)
  • Carlisle St between Dellview St and end of street
  • Cross St between Birrell St and Turner St (Southbound lanes only)

ONE WAY CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS

The following roads will become one-way only roads for the duration of the event:

From 9am, Fri 18 Oct until 10am, Mon 4 Nov:

  • Mirimar Ave northbound only from Hewlett St to Thompson St
  • Thompson St westbound only from Mirimar Ave to Ashley St
  • Ashley St northbound only from Darling St to Turner St

  • Marks Ln southbound only from Fletcher St to Kenneth St 

From 10am, Fri 18 Oct until 10am, Mon 4 Nov:

  • Gaerloch Ave southbound only from Alexander St to Dellview
  • Dellview St northbound only from Pacific Ave to Fletcher St

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 515, 521, 541, 544 and 555 will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed. Check travel alerts for the latest information and plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Granny Smith Festival, running from 9am until 8:30pm on Saturday

Changed traffic conditions include road closures and temporary no stopping zones will be in effect.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic in the area will be heavier than usual while closures and local traffic detours are in place.

Motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Road closures

  • Between 5.30pm Friday 18 October and 10pm Saturday 19 October including sections of West Pde, Hillview Rd, Rowe St, Progress Ave, Coolgun Ln and Trelawney St.
  • 5am until 12pm Saturday only, closures will be in place on Lakeside Rd between Wingate Ave and Hillview Rd, and Clive Rd
  • 6am until 7pm Saturday only, closures will be in place on Hillview Ln between Shaftsbury Rd and Lakeside Rd, and Hillview Lane car park
  • 8am until 11.30am Saturday only, closures will be in place on sections of Lakeside Rd, Hillview Rd, Shaftsbury Rd, Rowe St, Glen St and Richards Ave.

Temporary no-stopping zones will be in effect from 3.30pm Friday 18 October on sections of Trelawney St, Hillview Rd and Lakeside Rd, and between 6am and 9am Saturday 19 October on sections of Rutledge St. Check signs carefully. For more information see the event website.

roads.mainStreet: Lakeside Road, Glen Street, Shaftsbury Road and Rowe Street

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

  • From 6am to 6pm Durham St between Church St and Heath Ave, and Heath Ave from Durham St will be closed. Managed access will be maintained for local residents.

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 7:30am to 4pm lane 1 eastbound of River Rd will be closed between Lane Cove Country Club driveway (Stevenson St) and Greenwich Hospital Pedestrian Crossing (St Vincents Rd).

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets at Glebe

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 370, 431 and 433 are diverting around road closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways are place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

Roads in the vicinity of Glebe will begin closing at 8am and remain closed until 11:30pm. Police may restrict vehicle access along closed roads, including residents and businesses.

  • Sections of Cowper St, Derwent Ln, Derby Pl, Francis St, Glebe Point Rd, Mitchell St and Norton St are closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways are in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Cowper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Route 418, 423, 426, 429 and N40 buses will be diverting around the road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the Marrickville Festival being held along Marrickville Rd from 12pm to 6pm.

Road closures will be in place from 1.30am until 11pm. Motorists will be detoured via Illawarra Rd, Sydenham Rd, Victoria Rd and Calvert St

With large crowds expected traffic will be heavier than usual on roads in the area while closures and detours are in place.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.  

Road closures from 1.30am to 11pm:

  • Marrickville Rd between Illawarra Rd and Victoria Rd
  • Silver St between Marrickville Rd and 25 metres north of Marrickville Rd
  • Garners Ave between Garners Ave Carpark and Marrickville Rd
  • Seymour Lane between Garners Lane and Garners Ave
  • Frampton Ave between Seymour Lane and Marrickville Rd
  • Gladstone St between Marrickville Rd and Marrickville Lane
  • Silver St between Sydenham Rd and 25 metres north of Marrickville Rd *
  • Garners Ave between Illawarra Rd and Garners Ave Carpark *
  • Seymour Lane between Frampton Ave and Garners Lane *
  • Garners Lane north of Seymour Lane *
  • Central Lane between Victoria Rd and Meeks Rd
  • Victoria Lane between Sydenham Rd and Central Lane *

*Resident access maintained by traffic control at these locations.

properties.publicTransport: Free shuttle buses will run around course in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 15,000 participants will walk along a 28km circuit crossing seven iconic bridges in the annual 7 Bridges Walk event.

Participants will use existing off-road walkways and footpaths however there will be some minor road and lane closures in place to support pedestrian movements.

From 5am to 4pm the following roads within Callan Park will be closed:

  • Central Ave between Military Dr and North Crescent/Waterfront Dr
  • Military Dr between Wharf Rd and Central Ave 
  • North Crescent from Park Dr 
  • Waterfront Dr between Military Dr and Central Avenue

Motorists should slow down, watch for pedestrians and exercise caution.
The Morongla Show will be held on Monday 7 October 2024. A speed reduction of 40km/h will be in place on Lachlan Valley Way and Morongla Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip. The Entertainment Quarter is easily accessible by light rail and buses.
properties.otherAdvice:
Cold Chisel in The Showring at the Entertainment Quarter on Friday 11 and Saturday 12 October. Show starts 6pm and finished at 10pm each night.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as attendees travel to and from the shows, particularly during the Friday evening peak.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd, and to be aware of pedestrian activity in the area.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland St and Fitzroy St, and from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion St and Moore Park Rd. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator

properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival: Hill Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12.35pm, last race from 6.05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

A special Event Clearways will be in place from 7am to 8pm on Grand Avenue from 100m Prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Route 525 and route 526 will divert while road closures are in place. Event tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Monster Jam at Accor Stadium. Pit Party from 1.30pm. Show starts at 6pm, finish around 8pm.

With up to 50,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be close from 1.30pm for the safety of crowds within the precinct. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Tasmania JackJumpers at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 5:30pm, full time around 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists are advised to allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v Cairns Taipans at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip-off from 2.15pm, full time around 6.10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the game. Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
The Three Bridges Run will be taking place along the Parramatta River on 13 October. 42km start at 7am, 21km start at 7:20am, 10km start at 8am, course closed at 1pm. The course travels through George Kendall Riverside Park, Meadowbank Park, Rhodes Point, and Newington Nature Reserve using the Parramatta Valley.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta participants travel to and from the event. Allow extra travel time for travel.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads around Parramatta.

properties.publicTransport: Route 389 buses will be diverting around Stanley St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Stanley Street on October 19. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

The following roads will be closed from 8am to 11:30pm

  • Riley St between Francis Ln and Stanley Ln (both sides)
  • Stanly St between Yurong St and Crown St (both sides)
  • Yurong St between William St and Stanley St (eastern side)

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Chapel St, Crown St, Riley St, Stanley St and Yurong St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport:
The closest station to the University of Wollongong is North Wollongong on the South Coast Line. The university is approximately a 20-minute walk from the station.

The ‘free Gong shuttle’ (routes 55A and 55C) bus operates in both directions on a loop around Wollongong Station stopping at the University of Wollongong.

The shuttle bus runs every 20 minutes from 8am to 6pm on Saturday and Sunday.

Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
Yours and Owls Festival 10 Birthday Party will be held at the University of Wollongong on Saturday 12 October.

Attendees are encouraged to consider alternative transport options such as public transport and active transport.
The NSW Koori Knockout will be held from Friday 4 October through to Monday 7 October at the Hereford St Sporting Fields at Bathurst.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in concert tickets, additional light rail services will run frequently before and after the show. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Stray Kids World Tour at Allianz Stadium. Concert starts from 7.30pm, and finishes around 10.30pm.

With a crowd of more than 35,000 fans, traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Attendees are urged to catch public transport.

Changed traffic conditions

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • A pick up and drop off zone will be located on the northern side of Moore Park Rd at Oatley Rd opposite the stadium.
  • The Moore Park Rd/Fitzroy St cycleway will be closed from Poate Rd to Bourke St from 10pm to 11.30pm.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas on Saturday 26 October from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street and Moore Park Road, and from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Extra trains will run for event participants. Visit transportnsw.info for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 10,000 cyclists will ride from Sydney to Wollongong for the annual MS Gong Ride. The 82 km ride from Tempe Recreation Reserve starts from 6am and the 54km ride will start at Preston Park, Engadine from 7am. Both events finish at Lang Park, Wollongong by 4pm.

Road and lane closures will be in place along sections of the course.

  • 4am to 9:30am from Tempe to Sutherland: sections of West Botany St, Holbeach Ave and Bestic St. The speed limit will be reduced to 60/km along Rocky Point Rd/Taren Point Rd from Sans Souci to Taren Point.
  • 5am to 10am from Sutherland to Waterfall: Lane closures on the Princes Hwy from Kirrawee to Loftus and the speed limit will be reduced to 60km/h from Kirrawee to Waterfall. Delays are expected travelling southbound on the Princes Hwy during this time. 
  • 5am to 2:30pm in the Royal National Park: McKell Ave, Lady Wakehurst Dr, Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Otford Rd. Access to the Royal National Park is via Farnell Ave only. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Lawrence Hargrave Dr from Stanwell Park to Thirroul from 6am to 3pm.
  • 5am to 4.30pm in Wollongong: sections of Bourke St, Cliff Rd and George Hanley Dr will be closed. Sections of Hector St, Marine Dr and Hinton St around the finish area at Lang Park will remain closed until 7pm. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along Squires Way and George Hanley Dr between Fairy Meadow and Wollongong from 7am to 2pm

Motorists should exercise caution as cyclists will be sharing some roads along the course. Motorists are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

Special event clearways will be in place along key sections of the course between 4am and 4:30pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.﻿

FROM 4AM TO 9AM

arrangementElements.title: Speed zone reduction

roads.mainStreet: Princes Hwy, Royal National Park, Lawrence Hargrave Dr

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rufus Du Sol will be performing at Fleet Steps in the Royal Botanic Garden Sydney. Event starts from 5pm and finishes at approx. 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in the Sydney CBD on approaches to the Royal Botanic Gardens as attendees travel to the event during the already busy evening peak. Delays are expected on Mrs Macquaries Road while crowds leave the area between 8pm and 9pm.

Motorists travelling in the area should allow extra time and watch out for pedestrians.

The annual Dolly Parton Festival will be held Saturday 12 October from 7am to 4pm. The Mitchell Hwy from Merilba St to Meringo St will be closed for the street party. The Mitchell Hwy between Merilba St and Meringo St will be closed from 6.30am to 4pm with detours in place.
properties.diversions: Light vehicles will be detoured via Merilba St and Meringo St. Heavy vehicles must use the Manildra St and Culling St bypass.

properties.otherAdvice:
Delays are expected on major roads approaching Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Hwy and Bells Line of Rd from Sydney, Mitchell Hwy from Orange, Mid Western Hwy from Cowra and Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Traffic controllers will be on-site on local roads to manage access to and from the Mount Panorama precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time over the weekend and expect delays on Monday 14 October as fans head home from Bathurst.

_____________________________

VICTORIA PASS - Monday 14 October

Traffic is expected to be heavy along the Great Western Highway from Bathurst towards Sydney, with significant eastbound delays expected at Blackheath in the Blue Mountains. Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Great Western Highway at Mount Victoria, with queuing expected.

In the event of eastbound traffic queues extending from Blackheath to Mount Victoria, traffic management will be in place at the bottom of Victoria Pass on Great Western Highway, Little Hartley. Traffic will be held at this location to avoid breakdowns resulting from queuing on Victoria Pass, and to ensure the safe passage of motorists up the Pass. 

_______________________________

COWRA - Monday 14 October

Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Mid Western Hwy in Cowra with delays and queuing expected

The Kiama Triathlon will take place on Sunday 13 October from 8am to 4pm.

The Princes Hwy Northern Riverside Dr offramp will be closed for the event and detours are in place.
properties.diversions: A detour will be in place via the Southern Riverside Dr Offramp.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Spartan Race will be taking place on Saturday 12 October, as participants take place in multiple obstacle events.

There will be no right turn from Picton Rd into the event, motorists will need to detour via Maiden Bridge Rd roundabout.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place at the Maiden Bridge Rd roundabout to assist with traffic flow.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in concert tickets, additional light rail services will run frequently before and after the show. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Travis Scott: Circus Maximus Tour at Allianz Stadium on Thursday 17 & Friday 18 October. Gates open at 6pm, Concert starts from 8pm and finishes around 11pm.

With a crowd of more than 40,000 fans, traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park during the already busy weeknight evening peak.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Attendees are urged to catch public transport.

Changed traffic conditions

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12pm each day and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • A pick up and drop off zone will be located on the northern side of Moore Park Rd at Oatley Rd opposite the stadium.
  • The Moore Park Rd/Fitzroy St cycleway will be closed from Poate Rd to Bourke St from approx. 9.30pm to midnight.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas on Thursday 17 & Friday 18 October from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion Street and Moore Park Road, and from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland Street and Fitzroy Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.otherAdvice:
Banna Avenue will be closed between Crossing Street and Jondaryan Avenue for the Griffith Citrus Sculptures at the following times:

  • Set up - Sun 13 Oct 6am-2:30pm
  • Event launch - Fri 18 Oct 4:30pm-10:30pm
  • Pack up - Sun 27 Oct 6am-2:30pm

Detours will be in place for light and heavy vehicles.
properties.diversions:
Heavy vehicle detour via Bridge St and Crossing St during the exhibition.

Light vehicles will be detoured via Yambil St during the event launch.

All vehicles will be detoured via Bridge St and Crossing St during the installation and pack up of the event.

properties.publicTransport: Buses to and from Crows Nest will be diverting and using alternate while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual Crows Nest Fest from 10am to 5pm on Sunday 20 October.

Roads closures will be in place from 12:01am to 11pm on Sunday 20 October on sections of Willoughby Rd, Hume St Burlington St, Clarke St and local surrounding streets in the area.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Willoughby Rd and on detour routes throughout the day.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
The following roads will be closed for from 12:01am to 11pm on Sunday 20 October:

  • Willoughby Rd between Burlington St and Albany St 
  • Willoughby Rd (one-way) closed from Burlington St to Falcon St 
  • Clarke St between Willoughby Rd and Oxley St 
  • Clarke Ln between Hume St and Oxley St 
  • Burlington St between Willoughby Rd and Willoughby Ln 
  • Holtermann St between Willoughby Rd and Zig Zag Ln 
  • Hume St between Pacific Hwy and Pole Ln 
  • Hume Ln between Clarke Ln and Pole Ln 
  • Zig Zag Ln closed near Burlington St
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.otherAdvice:
The Boorowa Irish Woolfest will take place on Sunday 6 October from 8am to 4pm, celebrating the Irish heritage, ancestry and the world-class merino wool that the Boorowa Region has produced since the 1800s.

Marsden Street will be closed between Jugiong Street and Brial Street, detours will be in place.
properties.diversions: Motorists will be detoured via Brial St, Court St, Pudman St, Market St and Jugiong St.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Goulburn Lilac City Festival is Australia's longest continuously run community festival. It was established in 1951 and occurs annually. The festival offers a wide range of attractions and experiences including unique markets, food, flower displays, music performances, entertainment, exciting competitions, and much more.

There will be no access to Auburn St from Clinton St due to a local road closure, a detour will be in place.
properties.diversions: Westbound motorists will be detoured via Goldsmith St, Sloan St and Clinton St.

properties.otherAdvice: The Lismore Cycling Festival will be held on Saturday 5 and Sunday 6 October from 10am. Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists. Dawson Street from Magellan Street and Larkin Lane will be closed to motorists on the Saturday 5 October.
properties.diversions: Detour via Uralba and Diadem Streets.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Listen Out Music Festival at Centennial Park from 12pm to 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual in the area as crowds travel to and from the festival, and to the Everest Carnival at the nearby Royal Randwick Racecourse.

Sections of Driver Ave, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd are closed between 8pm and 11pm to allow festival goers to safely leave the area.

Motorists driving in the area should allow extra travel time.

Special event clearways are also in place between 12:01am and 11pm on key roads in Surry Hills, Centennial Park, Moore Park and Woollahra. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
The following roads are closed in Centennial Park and Moore Park, and will be progressively re-open after cleaning:

From ​8pm​ to ​11pm​

  • ​​Driver Ave​ between the southern turning circle and Lang Rd (southbound)
  • ​​Lang Rd between ​Errol Flynn Blvd​ to Anzac Pde (westbound)
  • *Lang Rd between Mithcell St and Moore Park Rd (both directions)
  • *​​Moore Park Rd​ between ​Oxford St​ and Cook Rd​ (westbound)

From ​9pm​ to ​11pm​

  • ​​Driver Ave between Lang Rd and the southern turning circle (northbound)
  • Lang Rd between Anzac Pde and Errol Flynn Blvd (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Rd between Oatley Rd and Oxford St (eastbound)

* Managed access area for residents and to/from Entertainment Quarter

Managed access to Entertainment Quarter on Errol Flynn Blvd will be maintained via Cook Rd by traffic control.

Special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect in Surry Hills, Centennial Park and Moore Park on the following roads:

Special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect in Centennial Park, Surry Hills and Moore Park on the following roads:

From 12:01am to 11:59pm:

  • Driver Ave between Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd (both sides)

From 6am to 11pm

  • Cleveland St between South Dowling St and City Rd (southern side)

From 12pm to 11pm

  • Oxford St between Queen St and Jersey Rd (southern side)
  • Oxford St between Queen St and Victoria Ave (northern side) 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and also apply to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Oxford Street, Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL & NRLW Grand Final at Accor Stadium on Sunday 6 October. Gates open at 1pm. NRLW Grand Final: Sydney Roosters v Cronulla Sharks kick-off 1:20pm, NRL Grand Final: Melbourne Storm v Penrith Panther kick-off 7:30pm, full-time approx. 9:15pm.

With around 80,000 people expected to attend the NRL & NRLW Grand Final, significant delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARKS: parking in the precinct is in high demand and expected to sell out before the event. Ticketholders who have to drive must pre-book parking ahead of time to secure a space.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

arrangementElements.html:
Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

webLinks.linkText: Cinema under the stars event page

properties.otherAdvice:
Cinema under the stars will be held at Speers Point Park, The Esplanade on Saturday 12 October.

On the Esplanade just near Park Road there will be a portable signalised pedestrian crossing to allow for the increase in pedestrian activity. Vehicle flow to be prioritised when queues begin to form. Contingency emergency detour route prepared if required.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, reduce speed and watch for pedestrians.

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the October long weekend.

Road closures will be implemented as precincts and car parks reach full at Wattamolla Beach, Audley, Maianbar, and Bundeena.

If parking capacity is reached across all precincts, traffic will only be permitted to travel through the park. If there are significant delays, both the northern and southern entries to the park, via Farnell Ave at Loftus and via Lady Wakehurst Dr at Otford, will close.

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access. Walking trails may also be closed due to fire bans and/or risks so plan ahead. 

Road closures when precincts reach capacity:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach is currently closed.
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township is currently closed.
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will be managing access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr.

  • Garie Rd remains closed from Sir Bertram Stevens Dr.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - October Long Weekend

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave & various roads
